entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 5:02AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak, Kobuk And Koyukuk Valleys... The northwest Interior received 2 to 5 inches of rainfall over the past week, with the heaviest amounts in the Upper Kobuk, Upper Noatak, and lower Koyukuk Valleys. entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 5:02AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tuesday and Wednesday Along The West Coast From the Bering Strait To The Yukon Delta... A strong storm developing in Eastern Russia today will move along the West Coast of Alaska on Tuesday, and into the Interior by Wednesday. This will bring south winds of 25 to 40 mph to the West Coast on Tuesday that will decrease slowly Tue night and Wed.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:35PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Randolph and southeastern Barbour Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 735 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Belington, or near Elkins, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN TUCKER COUNTY THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Parsons, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 5:27PM EDT until August 29 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS
